[{'created': '2018-12-17 16:11:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix check-network-gateway validation

The `undercloud.conf` file has now 2 sections (DEFAULT and ctlplane-subnet).
A small numbers of parameters have been deprecated and moved to the
ctlplane-subnet section.

This patch proposes to use 'crudini' to get parameter's values from the
undercloud.conf file instead of using the 'undercloud_conf' custom plugin.

This validation will now get the 'ctlplane-subnet/gateway' instead of
'DEFAULT/network_gateway', which has been deprecated.

Resolves:rhbz@1660088

Change-Id: I15f90676df0eac6172fc4049232754f630cf6eca
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix check-network-gateway validation

The `undercloud.conf` file has now 2 sections (DEFAULT and ctlplane-subnet).
A small numbers of parameters have been deprecated and moved to the
ctlplane-subnet section.

This patch proposes to use the 'ini' custom plugin to get parameter's values
from the undercloud.conf file instead of using the 'undercloud_conf' custom
plugin.

This validation will now get the 'ctlplane-subnet/gateway' instead of
'DEFAULT/network_gateway', which has been deprecated.

Resolves:rhbz#1660088

Change-Id: I15f90676df0eac6172fc4049232754f630cf6eca
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove package exclusion from yum and dnf

For some of the scripts with need the distro setuptools looks like this
exclusions where there so devstack don't break, but we are not using
devstack at tripleo.

Closes-Bug: #1808118

Change-Id: Ib776800a6f1480d05d06349506e8cd344096fc76

commit_message:
Test upgrading seed services in CI

Adds the kayobe-seed-upgrade-centos job, which performs an upgrade of
the seed services from the previous release to the current release.

Change-Id: Ia3eb39cf81cb3618fd94c4456bd576b52098c946
Story: 2004308
Task: 27873

commit_message:
Add kayobe seed service upgrade command

Adds a new command to upgrade containerised services on the seed:

kayobe seed service upgrade

This is largely the same as the deploy command, since there is no
kolla-ansible bifrost-upgrade command yet.

A limitation in Bifrost requires us to remove IPA images before
upgrading the bifrost container.

Change-Id: Ibbe01e972487e69dbb753a67efcf13e3ae0800de
Story: 2004308
Task: 27872

commit_message:
Fix best_match() deprecation warning

wsgi call to best_match() generates the following warning:

DeprecationWarning: The behavior of .best_match for the Accept classes
is currently being maintained for backward compatibility,
but the method will be deprecated in the future,
as its behavior is not specified in
(and currently does not conform to) RFC 7231.

See the following URL for more information about deprecation.

https://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/webob/en/stable/api/webob.html#webob.acceptparse.AcceptValidHeader.best_match

Simlar changes in the wsgi best language code as well,
except new call is to lookup().

Change-Id: Ib93ffffd3f28aa6d53a0a4eed5aeee94900cb073
Closes-Bug: #1798224

commit_message:
use payloads for ROUTER_INTERFACE BEFORE_DELETE events

This patch switches over to the payload style of callbacks by updating
neutron to callbacks to handle a DBEventPayload for BEFORE_DELETE events
of ROUTER_INTERFACE resources. See the depends on patch for more
details.

This change also disables legacy-tempest-dsvm-networking-bgpvpn-bagpipe
that is currently broken because of bug 1807152 - since both this change
and that bug break the gate, we have to squash.

Change-Id: Ieda7d74aec8ccad4b22e19b0470237fa70885714
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/598347/

commit_message:
Image conversion fails

It is not possible to convert glance images as it fails with error,
NoSuchOptError: no such option 'conversion_plugin_options' in group
[DEFAULT] as there is no 'conversion_plugin_options' option or group
in glance-image-import.conf file.

Used correct option group 'image_conversion' to fetch the image
'output_format' option.

Change-Id: Ia7ced170bcddcd3639b7edfb644deef3018b11a8
Closes-Bug: #1805765

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-23 16:30:27.000000000', 'message': 'Continue bringing up interfaces even if one fails

Currently os-net-config exits immediately if an interface fails to
come up.  This causes problems when we call it with a failsafe
configuration because it can result in working interfaces not
being configured if there are also non-functional interfaces, which
can leave a system unreachable over the network even though it may
have a working connection.

This change stores errors and handles them after all interfaces have
been processed to allow os-net-config to do what it can even with an
invalid configuration.  If any failures are detected it will still
cause os-net-config to report failure at the end.

Change-Id: I3bc75e217d0b7c5ae62900f4253ad57ee3720685
Closes-Bug: 1692725
'}, {'created': '2017-05-30 20:17:51.000000000', 'message': 'Continue bringing up interfaces even if one fails

This change stores errors and handles them after all interfaces have

commit_message:
Continue bringing up interfaces even if one fails

Currently os-net-config exits immediately if an interface fails to
come up.  This causes problems when we call it with a failsafe
configuration because it can result in working interfaces not
being configured if there are also non-functional interfaces, which
can leave a system unreachable over the network even though it may
have a working connection.

This change stores errors and handles them after all interfaces have
been processed to allow os-net-config to do what it can even with an
invalid configuration.  If any failures are detected it will still
cause os-net-config to report failure at the end.

Change-Id: I3bc75e217d0b7c5ae62900f4253ad57ee3720685
Closes-Bug: 1692725

commit_message:
Neutron Stein b1 release

Several fundamental changes recently happend in neutron:
- ryu -> os-ken switch
- policy-in-code support framework
- upgrade-checker framework

It is worth for a beta release.

Change-Id: I1d8733595bf48c289a16a6b3eeb787d39998d0ed

commit_message:
Ensure controller healthchecks passes without CRDs

This patch ensures the controller healthchecks do not set the
controller as not Ready due to missing CRDs when deploying without
namespace and/or policy handlers. In that case the CRDs are not needed

Closes-Bug: 1808966
Change-Id: I685f9a47605da86504619983848b8ef73d71b332

commit_message:
Remove unused params in jinja rendered network config templates

Since change I07822ec0cba7eed352c0010eb893b5e5a522e95c removed the
noop resources only parameters for networks used by the role is
passed to the network config templates.

Add a conditional when iterating over networks in jinja templates
so that only parameters for networks used by the role is included.

Change-Id: I8b6c7d247d719a7c8559c4be5e35c478a0f189f7
Related-Bug: #1800811

It's fine for me but maybe You should think of moving it to oslo_utils: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/master/oslo_utils/dictutils.py in the future?"}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-12-20 14:59:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(3 comments)

I know I'm leaving this comment two weeks after this change was merged, but please consider reverting this change before compare_dict() gets used in many places in the neutron code base.

Everything that's done by the compare_dict() method can be achieved by the builtin equality operator of python on properly chosen data types. compare_dict() hides a nasty surprise no code reader would expect. That is treating list values specially. The builtin pyhton way suprises no programmer. It's likely also much faster."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-12-21 15:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I113f120dba3c0ed7cbe1676f0a9fc8f1ba7ca2b9'}]

messages: [{'account_id': 29574, 'date': '2018-12-21 15:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29574, 'date': '2018-12-21 15:21:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nMistake.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-21 15:20:59.000000000', 'message': "Add support for aarch64 images

Jonathan Rosser <jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk>:

This patch introduces a map which allows tempest images to be specified
per CPU architecture. Appropriate images will be uploaded for x86_64 and
aarch64, alternatively tempest_images can be overridden by the deployer.

This change is primarily designed to enable tempest testing via AIO/CI
on architectures other than x86_64.

For aarch64 we must use a cirros 0.4.0 image, as there is no earlier
version available for this architecture.

==

Paul Martin <paul.martin@codethink.co.uk>:

Replace cirros image with one with updated kernel and grub-uefi.

The upstream Cirros 0.4.0 image contains a combination of kernel and
grub-uefi that doesn't parse the QEMU/KVM device tree information
correctly, leading to an image that fails to have a serial console or an
interrupt controller, so crashes silently at kernel initialization.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/620018
Change-Id: Ida3820a520b7c469e143ec4cc8bde41d9d48e710
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for aarch64 images

Jonathan Rosser <jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk>:

This patch introduces a map which allows tempest images to be specified
per CPU architecture. Appropriate images will be uploaded for x86_64 and
aarch64, alternatively tempest_images can be overridden by the deployer.

This change is primarily designed to enable tempest testing via AIO/CI
on architectures other than x86_64.

For aarch64 we must use a cirros 0.4.0 image, as there is no earlier
version available for this architecture.

==

Paul Martin <paul.martin@codethink.co.uk>:

Replace cirros image with one with updated kernel and grub-uefi.

The upstream Cirros 0.4.0 image contains a combination of kernel and
grub-uefi that doesn't parse the QEMU/KVM device tree information
correctly, leading to an image that fails to have a serial console or an
interrupt controller, so crashes silently at kernel initialization.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/620018
Change-Id: Ida3820a520b7c469e143ec4cc8bde41d9d48e710

commit_message:
Replace cirros image with one with updated kernel and grub-uefi.

The upstream Cirros image contains a combination of kernel and grub-uefi
that doesn't parse the QEMU/KVM device tree information correctly,
leading to an image that fails to have a serial console or an interrupt
controller, so crashes silently at kernel initialization.

Change-Id: Ie227054421035fe3245783c3fb6debde2427660c

commit_message:
Consume quota when importing backup resource

Now cinder will validate&consume backup quotas when
importing new backup resource.

Change-Id: I1825600dc6e01499c8fc4ede05400a180672e130
Closes-Bug:#1783525

commit_message:
Use template for lower-constraints

Small cleanups:

* Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template, remove individual
  jobs.
* Sort list of templates

Change-Id: Ie4fa0a49318e20b9c4a32db44de0bdb59666eddd

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-20 17:23:36.000000000', 'message': 'Update show_multiple_locations deprecation note

Update logged text to indicate our intentions with respect
to the show_multiple_locations configuration option, which
has been deprecated since Newton and advertised as subject
to removal in Pike.  Also correct the misleading impression
in the deprecation notice and earlier release notes that
functionality that requires show_multiple_locations = True
can be configured via policies at the current time.  Also
adds a release note to this effect.

Not a straight cherry-pick.  Changed the section of the
relase note from 'upgrade' to 'issues' because this is more
of a "known issue" in the stable branches.

Change-Id: I5bf0c8af9dfe87e0d17f7a16d4676f387b4379f6
Closes-bug: #1808375
(cherry picked from commit de72ac4a01be1ccc75825eb941dad64c170d6bea)
'}]
commit_message:
Update show_multiple_locations deprecation note

Update logged text to indicate our intentions with respect
to the show_multiple_locations configuration option, which
has been deprecated since Newton and advertised as subject
to removal in Pike.  Also correct the misleading impression
in the deprecation notice and earlier release notes that
functionality that requires show_multiple_locations = True
can be configured via policies at the current time.  Also
adds a release note to this effect.

Not a straight cherry-pick.  Changed the section of the
relase note from 'upgrade' to 'issues' because this is more
of a "known issue" in the stable branches.

Change-Id: I5bf0c8af9dfe87e0d17f7a16d4676f387b4379f6
Closes-bug: #1808375
(cherry picked from commit de72ac4a01be1ccc75825eb941dad64c170d6bea)

commit_message:
Add pools scenarios for octavia

Added the following scenarios:

- Octavia.create_and_list_pools
- Octavia.create_and_delete_pools
- Octavia.create_and_update_pools
- Octavia.create_and_show_pools

Supported pool_create parameters are admin_state, lb_algorithm,
protocol, description, session_persistence, loadbalancer_id.

Change-Id: Ifd192e87e8dfce7f3cd34157942a097a78a32cc6
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-19 14:14:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix images minimum ram and disk default values

When uploading an image, if we do not set a minimum ram and disk size we
try to send "None" to glance.
We should instead send "0" and glance will calculate the size from the
provided image.

Change-Id: Ia1aeabcdcf021943ebb7a4e35939c383ac820b19
Closes-Bug: #1809121
'}]
commit_message:
Fix images minimum ram and disk default values

When uploading an image, if we do not set a minimum ram and disk size we
try to send "None" to glance.
We should instead send "0" and glance will calculate the size from the
provided image.

Change-Id: Ia1aeabcdcf021943ebb7a4e35939c383ac820b19
Closes-Bug: #1809121

commit_message:
Remove check of deployment type in OS-Faults hook

It looks like deployment does not have `type` attribute anymore:

2018-12-20 11:31:56.827 32486 ERROR rally.task.hook
   File "/opt/stack/rally-openstack/rally_openstack/hook/fault_injection.py",
   line 61, in get_cloud_config
2018-12-20 11:31:56.827 32486 ERROR rally.task.hook
   if deployment_config["type"] != "ExistingCloud":
2018-12-20 11:31:56.827 32486 ERROR rally.task.hook KeyError: 'type'

Also correct parent class of FaultInjectionHook to avoid deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I2783757386c997a6555e6338aebcda4f9a5f31fa

commit_message:
Appointment of new Mistral PTL

Propose Renat Akhmerov as the new PTL for Mistral. I have discussed this
with Renat, who has a long history with the project and as the previous
PTL. See more details[1]

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/001020.html

Change-Id: I0963456b764b5ae38d3c2cc04100fbd1f1eac257

commit_message:
add explicit house rule for documentation changes

We have for a while now applied approval rules for "documentation"
updates that do not change policy. Document that rule.

Change-Id: Ia216f90ff1b2dd115af2f15fd50f914932fc2ae7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix ansible deprecation warnings

===
[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using tests as filters is deprecated.
Instead of using `result|search` use `result is search`. This
feature will be removed in version 2.9.
===

Change-Id: I158a42b82d1818fa4e9296343b1b4ab787e8d89d

subject: Explicitly declare Stein supported runtimes
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10608, 'name': 'Matthew Edmonds', 'email': 'edmondsw@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'edmondsw'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 11805, 'name': 'Corey Bryant', 'email': 'corey.bryant@canonical.com', 'username': 'coreycb'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-16 16:36:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-16 16:55:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

I'm good with this as it does clarify intent."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-16 17:18:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

I do like positioning it as an implicit cycle goal. An alternative approach might be to put the runtime version info in the releases repo instead, as it's more discoverable for users, but I'm good with either solution."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-16 17:21:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I did consider something for the releases repo, but finally ended up here as maybe does declare intent better and is coming from the group that I think should be declaring this.

We may still want to also do something in releases. Maybe here as the starting point declaring the goal, then the releases repo as documentation of what was actually done. That's something for further consideration though."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-17 00:00:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This makes sense in principle. I agree that if everything is going to get switched over in a single cycle then it needs to be a project-wide goal.

It would be nice to be more specific about what needs to change. We already have a goal to get everyone with py35 unit test jobs to add py36 unit test jobs in Stein. I think what we're saying here is (a) that all functional test jobs currently on Xenial should switch over to Bionic; and (b) py35 unit test jobs should be removed? I'd like to see it spelled out.

Finally, I think we should also update the Python PTI document at the same time."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-17 13:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-17 14:10:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Zane - my intent was not to state any kind of guidance on technical details relevant to this. It is intended to be a declarative statement that this release cycle should work with these runtimes, and that's it. The *how* of doing that is a different matter. We just need to be able to point somewhere to have a definitive statement on what was supported so we can stop having this vagueness now of needing to know what the LTS and stable releases were at the start of each cycle.

@Corey - I agree with you to some extent. That is why I recommended we have something like experimental jobs for N+1. We can't officially test on those future versions (because they don't actually exist yet) but we can start following a pattern where we can better prepare ourselves for them so it's less of a shock and last minute scramble when it comes time to move up to the next versions."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-17 14:22:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> @Corey - I agree with you to some extent. That is why I recommended
 > we have something like experimental jobs for N+1. We can't
 > officially test on those future versions (because they don't
 > actually exist yet) but we can start following a pattern where we
 > can better prepare ourselves for them so it's less of a shock and
 > last minute scramble when it comes time to move up to the next
 > versions.

What future versions don't exist yet? python3.7 is available in 18.04 and as of Thursday will be available in 18.10."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-17 20:23:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I completely agree that we need to be more specific and that we need to use that specificity to drive development activity (see my comments on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611010/ ) but I'm not confident that 3.6 is new enough. We want to be considering what is common at the end of the cycle, when we release, not at the beginning.

So I'm +1 on the concept, but -1 on the implementation, but so I'll leave a null vote for the moment. But thanks for getting this started."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-18 00:27:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> We just need to be able to point somewhere to have a definitive statement on what was supported so we can stop having this vagueness now of needing to know what the LTS and stable releases were at the start of each cycle.

That's a great step forward, but it still leaves a lot of vagueness about what to do. Move functional jobs to 3.6? Add unit test jobs for 3.6? Remove unit test jobs for 3.5? If any of that stuff is to get done it's going to have to be a project-wide goal. So why not put it in here rather than have two goals saying different parts of the same thing?"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-18 07:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-18 12:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-18 12:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-18 15:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-10-18 21:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from supported-runtimes to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-10-22 13:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-22 18:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-10-24 17:11:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-24 18:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-10-25 18:05:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-25 23:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-30 15:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I like the general approach taken here. I think we need to work out the question of version numbers before approving it.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-30 16:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-11-05 12:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I just wanted to relay Doug's comment from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610708, which was trying to add optional py37 unit tests to the python3-first goal: "I agree it is important to document the versions we're going to test with. I think modifying this goal document is the wrong way to do that. I like the idea of having it handled separately in something like https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611080/ instead."'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-05 21:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-05 22:00:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

response to doug within'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-05 22:36:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-11-06 17:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-11-06 17:48:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-11-06 19:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-10 08:18:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-11-20 19:48:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I'm OK with this. It makes things explicit, it's accurate, and it's consistent with the goal we have already set for unit tests (which is to get everything to test py36).

My only worry is that saying this isn't enough. It's not so explicit as to state that everybody needs to convert their integration test jobs over to Bionic, and it doesn't nominate a goal champion to help make that happen. Without something else, it seems that the likely outcomes are at best that nothing will happen, and at worst only some subset of projects will switch to Bionic, possibly even with the result that there is no distro on which you can install all of the Stein components simultaneously."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-21 16:30:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1

The versions are accurate. As Zane points out, we do likely need to have someone designated as goal champion to help teams understand what changes they need. The python3-first goal includes adding 3.6 unit test jobs, but doesn't address the upgrade to Bionic."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-11-21 21:04:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-21 22:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)

> we do likely need to have someone designated as goal champion

Maybe we need to find somewhere else to host this. My intention was that this was a statement of record for Stein, not a goal that needs a champion. We have never made applying our policy a cycle goal in the past, so not sure it makes sense here. This was just a convenient place I found for placing a declaration such as this for something cycle based, but we could make it a new higher level directory such as /runtimes or similar denoting cycle records?'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-11-22 08:44:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-11-26 15:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-11-26 17:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-26 17:16:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-26 17:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-11-26 18:14:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-27 09:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I find it sad that openSUSE Leap 15.0 is not listed, as this version has the same python support, and is therefore testable for projects.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-27 10:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

I like the fact we clarify what could be done for Stein in the current state of the art.

It interlinks well with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613145/ IMO.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-27 10:06:32.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Rollcall-Vote+1 by Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-27 10:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I like the fact we clarify what could be done for Stein in the current state of the art.

It interlinks well with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613145/ IMO.

However, I'd prefer if we update the documentation a little further, for example the PTI for python/js still refer to versions, and we should instead point to "per release" supported runtimes.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-27 14:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This isn't "what could be done for Stein" though, right? This is just stating, in writing, what our policy has always been.

This isn't a goal. This isn't an aspirational vision. It is just creating something that can be linked to and referred back to so it's clear what a given cycle was developed under.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-27 15:20:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-27 15:21:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Explicitly declare Stein supported runtimes

This adds a PTI section to have an official declaration of
the targeted runtimes for the release. This should also be retroactively
added to other cycle sections so we have a historical record of what was
supported for that release.

Javascript section omitted because I have zero experience with Node and
NPM, but it would be good to expand on this to include all of our
official runtimes.

Change-Id: I11b136a9781dd1a77df536f099df10a6dd524e06
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix ansible deprecation warnings

===
[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using tests as filters is deprecated.
Instead of using `result|search` use `result is search`. This
feature will be removed in version 2.9.
===

Change-Id: I8e856ecaeb82446785dbdcd23688bb0db0a30857

[{'created': '2018-12-03 18:42:47.000000000', 'message': "Fix ganesha for 0.0.0.0/0 access

Translate '0.0.0.0/0' to '0.0.0.0' when allowing IP
access with the ganesha driver since the ganesha back end
cannot handle the former expression and the latter has
the desired effect of allowing access to all IPs.

Closes-bug: #1800627

Change-Id: Ica698b6a70a128522c2c2de76a69e59207fd60ac
(cherry picked from commit a65c2b09746fe95d31c102d99c8e7674cddc82be)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ganesha for 0.0.0.0/0 access

Translate '0.0.0.0/0' to '0.0.0.0' when allowing IP
access with the ganesha driver since the ganesha back end
cannot handle the former expression and the latter has
the desired effect of allowing access to all IPs.

Closes-bug: #1800627

Change-Id: Ica698b6a70a128522c2c2de76a69e59207fd60ac
(cherry picked from commit a65c2b09746fe95d31c102d99c8e7674cddc82be)

commit_message:
Add tempestconf_git_url var for tempestconf testing

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625904/ provides the support of
installing python-tempestconf from git in ci. In order to
exercise the test, we need to add tempestconf_git_url in
test-vars.yml for the same.

Change-Id: I36852e94718de438f02bc2de025403ed4f1f3592

Closes-Bug: #1808302

commit_message:
Add contrib/ dir to setup.cfg

contrib directory contains ovs-dpdk.j2 template override, but
exists only in git repository - not in the pip package contents.

Change-Id: Ic034331032810a2003a328b82492c6fd56ddd85f
Closes-Bug: #1808302

commit_message:
Fix image_name retrieval in custom-image jobs

And use a 'file://' url for the custom manila image.

See also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/623330.  These
are interdependent patches but no harm is done by merging
this one first and having 623330 depend on it since retrieval
of the image name is not working correctly anyways.

Partial-Bug: #1807969

Change-Id: Ib3a74d170f159dfbc38b5302f00800f3530f4921

[{'created': '2018-11-26 14:26:47.000000000', 'message': "Generate bifrost hostvars prior to provisioning

The 'kayobe overcloud inventory discover' command can be used to discover an
overcloud inventory from the nodes in the ironic service running on the seed.
This works well for cases where the nodes have been autodiscovered, and as such
do not exist in the kayobe inventory.

There is another use case where overcloud nodes already exist in the kayobe
inventory. In that case we don't want to run the above command, as it will
create duplicate hosts in the inventory. We do however want the part of that
command that generates bifrost host variables for the overcloud nodes.

This change moves the generation of bifrost host variables to the kayobe
overcloud provision command, which is used in each of these cases.

commit_message:
Generate bifrost hostvars prior to provisioning

The 'kayobe overcloud inventory discover' command can be used to discover an
overcloud inventory from the nodes in the ironic service running on the seed.
This works well for cases where the nodes have been autodiscovered, and as such
do not exist in the kayobe inventory.

There is another use case where overcloud nodes already exist in the kayobe
inventory. In that case we don't want to run the above command, as it will
create duplicate hosts in the inventory. We do however want the part of that
command that generates bifrost host variables for the overcloud nodes.

This change moves the generation of bifrost host variables to the 'kayobe
overcloud provision' and 'kayobe overcloud hardware inspect' commands,
which are used in each of these cases.

Change-Id: I8a69ccd5192c0c5beeb7efb36c09b2c4643ef150
Story: 2004426
Task: 28079

commit_message:
Clean up image build script.

With the dependent changes, we no longer attempt to use a local
webserver to hand off newly created manila service images.

So simplify this script to remove the branch that sets up this
local webserver.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/623551/
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/623330
Change-Id: I5795928d6de64ea6602141f494252d7b75fdfbe9

Next fix needed.

Modified 623551 to persist MANILA_SERVICE_IMAGE_URL and MANILA_SERVICE_IMAGE_NAME in local.conf and now we see these set in devstack itself, not just in the pre_test_hook.

But we get a 404 trying to retrieve the image from the local web server:

http://logs.openstack.org/30/623330/4/check/manila-tempest-dsvm-generic-scenario-custom-image/9cc95c7/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2018-12-08_11_18_04_968

I'm going to try modifying 623551 to use a file:// path instead in the url."}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-08 12:11:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-08 14:55:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Using a file:// path instead of trying to get the custom image from a local webserver works.  We see devstack using the file path [1].  We see it create a glance image successfully [2].  And we see nova using that image (same uuid) to boot up a service VM [3].

Something seems messed up with the networking though.  I don't see the paramiko protocol header error but the SVM isn't successfully connected either.


[1] http://logs.openstack.org/30/623330/4/check/manila-tempest-dsvm-generic-scenario-custom-image/f2bd5db/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2018-12-08_12_53_28_022

recheck

let's see if the network errors are consistent run to run"}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-09 18:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-11 14:36:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-11 15:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The new image is set in the MANILA_SERVICE_IMAGE_URL in the devstack log [1] and we see it uploaded to glance [2] for use as the service image by manila with the generic driver.

commit_message:
Save service image URL properly

Put the image name in a file for retrieval by jobs that
need it so they don't have to play (buggy) tricks with
git to get it.  Also ensure that debootstrap is installed.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/623551
Closes-bug: #1807969
Change-Id: I6dfeb5fb236579aa1755c6806f9ffc397690fba6

commit_message:
Fix bifrost automation tasks for Rocky

Changes to the openstack ansible modules and client SDKs have rendered our
authentication for ironic invalid. Bifrost now provides a working clouds.yaml,
so use this instead of the fudged endpoint/token setup in env-vars.

Also updates some use of the ironic client to the openstack client, and adds
support for the new 'inspect wait' ironic state to avoid surprises during
inspection.

Change-Id: I15ea388b6df8ced9cc0e0eceed8dec8aa8f57a9b
Story: 2001864
Task: 28078

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-23 15:52:16.000000000', 'message': 'Use host vars files for kolla ansible inventory

Kayobe writes out several host variables to the Kolla ansible inventory
files, etc/kolla/inventory/seed and etc/kolla/inventory/overcloud. These
include ansible_host, and network interfaces such as api_interface,
ironic_dnsmasq_interface, etc.

In Ansible, these should have a higher precedence than the kolla ansible
group variables in ansible/group_vars/all.yml that set the defaults.
However, in Ansible 2.4+, if the host has the same name as a group that
it is in, the group variables now take precedence, meaning that it is
not possible to override them.

This was observed when using the kayobe-config-dev repo for testing,
where the seed host is in the seed group.

Admittedly ansible does tell you not to do this: [WARNING]:
Found both group and host with same name: localhost

The solution used here is to use a separate host_vars file for each
host. Alternatively we could enforce that hostnames and groups do not
overlap.

Change-Id: I349c8279d85a591689ac8108bce14d96889440fe
Story: 2004418
Task: 28065

Change-Id: I349c8279d85a591689ac8108bce14d96889440fe
Story: 2004418
Task: 28065

commit_message:
Use host vars files for kolla ansible inventory

Kayobe writes out several host variables to the Kolla ansible inventory
files, etc/kolla/inventory/seed and etc/kolla/inventory/overcloud. These
include ansible_host, and network interfaces such as api_interface,
ironic_dnsmasq_interface, etc.

In Ansible, these should have a higher precedence than the kolla ansible
group variables in ansible/group_vars/all.yml that set the defaults.
However, in Ansible 2.4+, if the host has the same name as a group that
it is in, the group variables now take precedence, meaning that it is
not possible to override them.

This was observed when using the kayobe-config-dev repo for testing,
where the seed host is in the seed group.

Admittedly ansible does tell you not to do this: [WARNING]:
Found both group and host with same name: localhost

The solution used here is to use a separate host_vars file for each
host. Alternatively we could enforce that hostnames and groups do not
overlap.

Change-Id: I349c8279d85a591689ac8108bce14d96889440fe
Story: 2004418
Task: 28065

commit_message:
DNM: Put etcd on another host

Commit extends all jobs with a subnode and puts etcd there. It's aimed
to test if it's contention issue with other OpenStack or K8s services.

Change-Id: I04bb2e447e30db594bae71995d65be9053e4854d

[{'created': '2018-12-20 21:32:00.000000000', 'message': "Allow skip processing exposed ports

The endpoints 'network_driver_program_external_connectivity'
and 'network_driver_revoke_external_connectivity' will dynamically
create security group and security group rules to open the ports
exposed by the docker container. However, such processing invokes
too much neutron API calls thus significantly slowing down the
container start/stop. However, such processing is not mandatory
because users can manually configure the SGs to achieve the
equivalent.

This patch make the processing of exposed ports configurable.
As a result, it can be disabled if users want a better performance.

Change-Id: I6d6d176512e6b30bb7372408aec1a7bac12335ab
(cherry picked from commit 17db307e274035fbe65e99a29eec6638e6ec1e2d)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow skip processing exposed ports

The endpoints 'network_driver_program_external_connectivity'
and 'network_driver_revoke_external_connectivity' will dynamically
create security group and security group rules to open the ports
exposed by the docker container. However, such processing invokes
too much neutron API calls thus significantly slowing down the
container start/stop. However, such processing is not mandatory
because users can manually configure the SGs to achieve the
equivalent.

This patch make the processing of exposed ports configurable.
As a result, it can be disabled if users want a better performance.

Change-Id: I6d6d176512e6b30bb7372408aec1a7bac12335ab
(cherry picked from commit 17db307e274035fbe65e99a29eec6638e6ec1e2d)

commit_message:
Set admin url endpoints insecure flag for nova client

In case the keystone admin endpoint uses SSL and self-signed
certificates, it should not try to verify the certificates.

Change-Id: Ia0b4c750f484c44fcdc700e1d1c4edcdb0ad2fd7
Closes-Bug: 1808335

commit_message:
Fix destination_type attribute in the bdm_v2 documentation

All the clients using block device mapping are using the attribute
destination_type and the documentation points to dest_type instead.

Change-Id: Iba6e698e826d1a1898fde5cc999592f5821e3ebc
Co-Authored-By: David Moreno Garcia <david.mogar@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1808358

commit_message:
Allow setting explicit osd type as well as wal and db locations.

Since the luminous release bluestore has become the default.
ceph-disk silently ignores the journal specification and it's not
possible to create filestore backed OSDs.

Change-Id: Ie5a19d347bdcb162a2aa3607425478062d4f004d

commit_message:
Ensure lb sg rules are not updated without namespaces

This patch ensures Octavia LoadBalancer SG rules are not updated
by the lbaas driver when the namespace isolation feature is not
enabled.

Closes-Bug: 1809119
Change-Id: I09af490e77fcb722115e75147d5d004b2f4e6426
(cherry picked from commit 3baaccdc039754e9fc72d9738a4fb39fdf4099e6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-20 11:05:15.000000000', 'message': 'Temporary remove selinux label mount option for neutron

Neutron services failing with below Error when running with podman(0.12.1)
and container-selinux(2.77):-

relabel failed "/run/netns": operation not supported

Until this is fixed in podman/container-selinux, temporary remove selinux
relabel on /run/netns.

Change-Id: I596074fcc2318ebb3d7efb0128a2b25527e19808
Partial-Bug: #1809218
'}]
commit_message:
Temporary remove selinux label mount option for neutron

Neutron services failing with below Error when running with podman(0.12.1)
and container-selinux(2.77):-

relabel failed "/run/netns": operation not supported

Until this is fixed in podman/container-selinux, temporary remove selinux
relabel on /run/netns.

Change-Id: I596074fcc2318ebb3d7efb0128a2b25527e19808
Partial-Bug: #1809218

commit_message:
Only run the needed services for CephFS jobs

These jobs often fail due to timeouts so only enable the services
required for devstack tests with these back ends.

Change-Id: Ib620ec3c2a9999ea9908a7c23aa7172c40a4cbd9
(cherry picked from commit f096d1145c7b14fae2c666b8d088574e570bffd4)

commit_message:
Create reproducer_extra_vars.yml with vars used in run-v3.yaml

For reproducer we need to pass the right vars to run-v3. This
defines a new heredoc for a reproducer_extra_vars.yaml which
will can then be passed with --extra-vars @.

This will replace the env_vars_to_src.sh (we are using the same
mechanism for the extra_vars added here).

Also builds the list of repos to clone from the zuul playbooks

CI task: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/353
Depends-On: Ib552af604798485809ff0528fe3c1b6d340a6523
(actually depends on https://review.openstack.org/616284 but dnm
test review ontop of 616284 used instead update before merge)
Change-Id: If61736d48443f73aa327c028e3a9dc6ff1023104

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-14 08:32:48.000000000', 'message': 'Use volume v3 API in clouds.yaml by default

Volume API v2 has been deprecated for a long time.
There is no reason to use volume v2 in clouds.yaml by default.

This commit also drops "--os-identity-api-version 3" from
write_clouds_yaml in functions -common as "3" is the default value
of tools/update_clouds_yaml.py. They are hardcoded in DevStack
so there is no reason to pass it.

Change-Id: Ie84026a3d19f7711fc781b7012355096c7ff6b5a
'}]
commit_message:
Use volume v3 API in clouds.yaml by default

Volume API v2 has been deprecated for a long time.
There is no reason to use volume v2 in clouds.yaml by default.

This commit also drops "--os-identity-api-version 3" from
write_clouds_yaml in functions -common as "3" is the default value
of tools/update_clouds_yaml.py. They are hardcoded in DevStack
so there is no reason to pass it.

Change-Id: Ie84026a3d19f7711fc781b7012355096c7ff6b5a

commit_message:
Drop Octavia providers supported protocols list

Currently, Kuryr LBaaS driver maintains a list of
supported protocols per Octavia provider.
This list is used for optimizing listener creation
flow (don't send a request to Octavia if the provider
doesn't support this protocol).

Since this list is actually an Octavia attribute, it will
be more robust to delete this list from Kuryr and handle
the corresponding exception in case specific protocol
is not supported by Octavia provider.

Change-Id: I94d6de873fc4d3bfafdfd591a15ba82fb4e38ec3
Closes-Bug: 1809049

commit_message:
Use the base OS image for tripleoclient base

Building from openstack-base brings a lot of unneeded overhead into the
end container. We only need a minimal setup, so let's rely on
dependencies of the python-tripleo package instead of explicitly
pulling in world from openstack-base. That saves space, and reduces
potential attacks vectors and CVEs to maintain for the tripleoclient
container.

Related: blueprint zero-footprint

Change-Id: If70351aac67bf62274a068cb4ebfe9c5270da5ae
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-20 12:45:49.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Log alembic migration script's output with oslo_log"

This reverts commit dffcf4b54a29e64a026bcda9795b57953388019c.

Prior to this patch, output to stdout would look as follows:

INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Context impl MySQLImpl.
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Will assume non-transactional DDL.
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Context impl MySQLImpl.
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Will assume non-transactional DDL.
  Need to apply migrations from neutron contract branch. This will require all Neutron server instances to be shutdown before
  proceeding with the upgrade.

However, with this patch, now only the following shows up:

INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Context impl MySQLImpl.
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Will assume non-transactional DDL.
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Context impl MySQLImpl.
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Will assume non-transactional DDL.

The message to notify the deployer to run migrations does not appear to be
present in any log files either.

The message and return code are used by deployment projects to determine
whether migrations must be run, for example:

https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/blob/e34b27e5ae6405bf587ea01b70e63bac4b9efb10/tasks/neutron_db_setup.yml#L59-L69

Change-Id: I9c9959d4e8407cdc5f7a24a76a222b2bdfc87d4b
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Log alembic migration script's output with oslo_log"

This reverts commit dffcf4b54a29e64a026bcda9795b57953388019c.

Prior to this patch, output to stdout would look as follows:

INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Context impl MySQLImpl.
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Will assume non-transactional DDL.
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Context impl MySQLImpl.
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Will assume non-transactional DDL.
  Need to apply migrations from neutron contract branch. This will require all Neutron server instances to be shutdown before
  proceeding with the upgrade.

However, with this patch, now only the following shows up:

INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Context impl MySQLImpl.
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Will assume non-transactional DDL.
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Context impl MySQLImpl.
INFO  [alembic.runtime.migration] Will assume non-transactional DDL.

The message to notify the deployer to run migrations does not appear to be
present in any log files either.

The message and return code are used by deployment projects to determine
whether migrations must be run, for example:

https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/blob/e34b27e5ae6405bf587ea01b70e63bac4b9efb10/tasks/neutron_db_setup.yml#L59-L69

Change-Id: I9c9959d4e8407cdc5f7a24a76a222b2bdfc87d4b

commit_message:
Support HP MSA 2050 Storage

Because MSA 2050 return "Success" for 'response-type' unlik 2040,
cinder driver should check return value as an case insensitive.

Change-Id: Ibd6040e2c7376e893dcf34a56d678cabc81b2f21
Closes-Bug: #1808968

[{'created': '2018-12-18 08:56:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix dependency on requests library version

The code was calling property Response.next which is only available in
requests >= 2.15.0 [1]. At present minimum version of requests library
is 2.14.2 in requirements.txt. Instead of bumping its version (impacts
packaging specially to already released OpenStack versions), we can
solve it on our side with this patch.

The error was:
    AttributeError: 'Response' object has no attribute 'next'

[1] https://github.com/requests/requests/blob/v2.15.0/HISTORY.rst

commit_message:
Fix dependency on requests library version

The code was calling property Response.next which is only available in
requests >= 2.15.0 [1]. At present minimum version of requests library
is 2.14.2 in requirements.txt. Instead of bumping its version (impacts
packaging specially to already released OpenStack versions), we can
solve it on our side with this patch.

The error was:
    AttributeError: 'Response' object has no attribute 'next'
    
[1] https://github.com/requests/requests/blob/v2.15.0/HISTORY.rst

Story: 2004641
Task: 28591

Change-Id: I15b496c740b0c7c8970501d08497ba43cbffda2b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-19 04:24:08.000000000', 'message': "Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic and so on.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: I07048817eb826337dd5bd89a97711bb9d43495cf
"}]
commit_message:
Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic and so on.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: I07048817eb826337dd5bd89a97711bb9d43495cf

commit_message:
Set OpenSUSE jobs to non-voting

Due to some sort of packaging issue, the OpenSUSE jobs
have been failing for two days. As previously agreed,
this is the threshold to make them non-voting to unblock
development work while the issue is resolved.

Change-Id: Ib58c75d24e81ea8daf98e31caf42384807bdefe7

commit_message:
(calico) Add network policy safety valve

- If a rule set in the network policy override for the calico
  chart is empty, it causes the calico-settings job to fail. This
  safety valve should handle the empty list gracefully.

Change-Id: I4b8a39941f05a8eb86734ff129b2d73830883236

commit_message:
Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic and so on.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: Ia76a59a029b7a8b869759be5d7b73b426bcc1c4d

commit_message:
Ignore floating ips not attached to instances

If floating ip is on a port attached to devices other than a nova
compute instance, (e.g. it is attached to a loadbalancer) ignore it.

Change-Id: Icda92f0f4b5246aebb082cf48bef751d9e6df2ba

commit_message:
Use ksa adapter for neutron client

nova.network.neutronv2.api.get_client now uses the common
get_ksa_adapter utility to create an Adapter from common keystoneauth1
configuration options if the legacy [neutron] config option ``url`` is
not specified.

As part of blueprint use-ksa-adapter-for-endpoints, this provides a
consistent mechanism for endpoint communication from Nova.

Change-Id: I41724a612a5f3eabd504f3eaa9d2f9d141ca3f69
Partial-Implements: bp use-ksa-adapter-for-endpoints

subject: Bump minimal_image_ref
messages:
[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-18 13:37:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-18 16:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

grenade breaks with the new image, need to fix that.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-18 16:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-12-18 17:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-12-18 21:32:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Before this patch, grenade was the only thing working. After, it's the only thing not working.

It's correctly using the old DEFULT_IMAGE_NAME on the previous branch and the new one on the new branch. It seems like the problem is that grenade/devstack does not re-download images after the upgrade, so only the old image is present. I'm not sure why though because it *does* appear in IMAGE_URLS: http://logs.openstack.org/12/625912/2/check/grenade-heat/c0ae271/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-12-18_17_48_16_744

A possible solution might be to only set heat_plugin minimal_image_ref if it's not already configured? Otherwise we'll have to find a way to convince devstack to download the new image."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-19 04:37:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-19 06:57:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

creates more issues.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-19 08:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-19 08:13:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I've one more go at it. As won't be around, feel free to take over and update it."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-19 10:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-19 10:18:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

so the image issue was sorted in the last patch, but it messed up $DEST which means tempest config was written to the old location.

Hopefully the the new patch would fix it.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-12-19 10:41:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Remarkably, this almost makes sense to me :)

Let's see if it passes."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-12-19 21:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-20 03:58:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-21 03:33:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Bump minimal_image_ref

Devstack bumped[1] the cirros image version. Changes
to source the old openrc file for grenade before configuring
tempest.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/624716/

Change-Id: I9481bbcb03609db6d2224998a4f83d3a8790e96c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-18 06:07:19.000000000', 'message': "VMAX Driver - Place volume in SG as part of unmanage volume

A cinder unmanage operation using the VMAX driver doesn't place
the volume in any storage group on the array. This leads to querying
information about the volume very difficult. The volume being unmanaged
should be placed in some storage group as part of the unmanage
operation

Change-Id: I4fd5370005848205e1bbc9d58d8452f38719dac8
Closes-bug: 1792888
"}, {'created': '2018-09-24 16:58:01.000000000', 'message': "VMAX Driver - Place volume in SG as part of unmanage volume

A cinder unmanage operation using the VMAX driver doesn't place
the volume in any storage group on the array. This leads to querying
information about the volume very difficult. The volume being unmanaged
should be placed in some storage group as part of the unmanage
operation

commit_message:
VMAX Driver - Place volume in SG as part of unmanage volume

A cinder unmanage operation using the VMAX driver doesn't place
the volume in any storage group on the array. This leads to querying
information about the volume very difficult. The volume being unmanaged
should be placed in some storage group as part of the unmanage
operation

Change-Id: I4fd5370005848205e1bbc9d58d8452f38719dac8
Closes-bug: 1792888

[{'created': '2018-12-21 02:39:40.000000000', 'message': 'Nomarlize the docker image pull policy.

The image policy should be described as "Always","Never","IfNotPresent"
whose first letter should be capital. But in many files, we write
"always"."never","ifnotpresent". This is not normative and in latest
version of Kubernetes, it is not supported.

Change-Id: Ib36a9f1955079602ecc1b2e18693c6c2961f8959
Closes-Bug:#1809350
'}]
commit_message:
Nomarlize the docker image pull policy.

The image policy should be described as "Always","Never","IfNotPresent"
whose first letter should be capital. But in many files, we write
"always"."never","ifnotpresent". This is not normative and in latest
version of Kubernetes, it is not supported.

Change-Id: Ib36a9f1955079602ecc1b2e18693c6c2961f8959
Closes-Bug:#1809350

(1 comment)

Need to pre-load system_metadata for the password route.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-17 23:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-17 23:09:09.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

The join in security_groups should be trivial since the table should be empty in neutron cases, and when getting base metadata we also return the password which is stored in instance.system_metadata, so pre-joining instance_system_metadata is actually something we should be doing when we pull the instance from the cell database - it's used more than just vendordata v2 requests, which makes this change essentially not worthwhile.

We either need to optimize how we do the system_metadata joins in the sqlalchemy API code, or we need to reconsider how we store the instance password (move it out of system_metadata)."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-12 18:18:30.000000000', 'message': 'Be smarter about DB joins in the metadata API

When serving a request to the metadata API, we get the
instance record out of the cell database along with
joining on several other tables, and not all of those
are needed based on configuration:

* We don't need to join on security_groups if we're
  using neutron (meta-api will get neutron security
  group information for the instance from neutron
  directly since nova doesn't cache that info in the
  DB).

* We don't need to join on system_metadata unless a
  dynamic vendordata provider is being used (the
  request to dynamic vendordata providers includes
  the "boot_roles" information which is stashed in
  system_metadata).

Also, the password handler can also be optimized to
join on system_metadata explicitly and avoid a lazy-load
of that information (Instance.get_by_uuid by default
joins on info_cache and security_groups).

In the long ago (kilo), system_metadata would have been
used if the instance.flavor internal data storage needed to
be migrated to the instance_extra table, but that data
migration needed to be completed by the time people upgraded
to Liberty:

  Ide5492b8b52dec665088d7bca78c386418eba0fe

So that data migration is no longer a concern here.

Change-Id: I863d42c25b0872c1864ad7ef92180563eab93ef5
Partial-Bug: #1799298
Related-Bug: #1808010
'}]
commit_message:
Be smarter about DB joins in the metadata API

When serving a request to the metadata API, we get the
instance record out of the cell database along with
joining on several other tables, and not all of those
are needed based on configuration:

* We don't need to join on security_groups if we're
  using neutron (meta-api will get neutron security
  group information for the instance from neutron
  directly since nova doesn't cache that info in the
  DB).

* We don't need to join on system_metadata unless a
  dynamic vendordata provider is being used (the
  request to dynamic vendordata providers includes
  the "boot_roles" information which is stashed in
  system_metadata).

Also, the password handler can also be optimized to
join on system_metadata explicitly and avoid a lazy-load
of that information (Instance.get_by_uuid by default
joins on info_cache and security_groups).

In the long ago (kilo), system_metadata would have been
used if the instance.flavor internal data storage needed to
be migrated to the instance_extra table, but that data
migration needed to be completed by the time people upgraded
to Liberty:

  Ide5492b8b52dec665088d7bca78c386418eba0fe

So that data migration is no longer a concern here.

Change-Id: I863d42c25b0872c1864ad7ef92180563eab93ef5
Partial-Bug: #1799298
Related-Bug: #1808010

commit_message:
[gnocchi] don't randomize job names

Random job names mean `helm upgrade` or indeed anything looks for
changes from rendered templates will see changes when there are none
causing churn and restarts.

Change-Id: I59e6a60d6c4c601c5c8cecbd8238af6b7c5f389e

messages:
[{'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-09-19 23:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-09-19 23:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-09-19 23:49:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I considered catching the exception in the validate_metric() and prepending the name to the message before re-throwing, but as each check has its own exception type that would not have saved any code.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-09-27 16:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-10-01 17:29:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-10-24 10:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

Could you add a story for this please. You could add there a copy of log messages if still available.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:35:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for the comments.  I found that this fix was not enough (as you mentioned there are other places where the functions are called) and had considered some other options but neglected to come back and mark this WIP.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-10-25 20:19:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Story created - https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2004185
Don't yet have a good approach for how to address the monasca-api and monasca-log-api calls for individual fields."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-10-26 14:01:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Don't yet have a good approach for how to address the monasca-api
 > and monasca-log-api calls for individual fields.

My suggestion:

1. Leave function signatures unchanged.
2. Declare `ValidationException` class.
3. Inherit from it:

  class InvalidValue(ValidationException):

4. In `validate_metric` catch it:

  try:
    ...
  catch ValidationException:

5. In APIs catch exception and log meaningful, case specific details."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-10-26 14:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Btw. after merging https://review.openstack.org/586510 we will see if the logs pipeline is affected.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-12-21 04:33:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandon in favor of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626761/'}]

commit_message:
Add the metric name to the Exception messages when validation fails

When trying to debug a problem where a None value was being set for
a metric, it was very difficult to find the source because the name
of the metric was not included in the Exception message.
This commit adds the name to the validation messages for validation
methods that occur after the name has been validated.

Change-Id: I130b13d5b8a5c359063dfd67a7b934b723c7b8bf

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-20 11:23:42.000000000', 'message': "Add support for microversion 3.42 (os-extend)

The 'cinder extend' command lacks support for microversion 3.42.
Currently the shell command of 'os-extend' is in v2 version, only
supports volume expansion for 'available' status, and adds support for
'available' and 'in-use' status volumes in v3 version.

Change-Id: I1db07735896cd64b2fcaed5cb2718b52a311d72a
Closes-Bug: #1809245
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for microversion 3.42 (os-extend)

The 'cinder extend' command lacks support for microversion 3.42.
Currently the shell command of 'os-extend' is in v2 version, only
supports volume expansion for 'available' status, and adds support for
'available' and 'in-use' status volumes in v3 version.

Change-Id: I1db07735896cd64b2fcaed5cb2718b52a311d72a
Closes-Bug: #1809245

commit_message:
Remove chgrp from rootwrap filters

Use privsep instead of rootwrap filters for chgrp, this is
a basic code copy so we can use chgrp with privsep.

Change-Id: Iec796bd84a095444cb753678ef4181b761486c3f
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Neutron PodSecurityContext

securityContext with non-root user is implemented
at Pod level and leveraged the helm-toolkit snippet

Fix for adding allowPrivilegeEscalation flag in container
securityContext in the neutron charts whereever needed

Depends-On: I95264c933b51e2a8e38f63faa1e239bb3c1ebfda

Change-Id: Id93b56d2e3886b9dd9115e79c28f661930146b00

commit_message:
Move tgt-admin to privsep

Convert usage of tgt-admin to use privsep rather than
the rootwrap wrapper.

Change-Id: I156786fcad09d031f2defa6d524f7ada5db76d63
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix postgresql version in metadata

puppetlibs-postgresql is now using the 5.10.0 version, so we should fix the
postgresql version in metadata.

commit_message:
Migrate linting to pre-commit

Follows the same linting configuration that was implemented first in
tripleo-quickstart-extras which makes used of pre-commit tool for
managing all linters.

This also avoids problems where a new linter release may break our
gates because pre-commit always pins versions.

Removes ansible from requirements.txt as it needs to be listed only
in ansible-requirements.txt

Change-Id: Ia229d3d58763d743bd19ad9099d7907561f3c77f
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626000/
